info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EVANS, BULLOCH AND CANDLER COUNTIES... At 530 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Register, or 8 miles south of Statesboro, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph, up to penny sized hail and excessive cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. All outdoor activities should cease. Move indoors immediately. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Statesboro, Metter, Claxton, Brooklet, Hagan, Portal, Pulaski and Register. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
